data.title: Add Project Folder should open something relevant to the current context
data.body:
### Description

Issue is similar to #6762, but it happens when adding a project folder. It then opens the "Recently Used" view on Linux, rather than something more relevant.

1. I'm assuming that just like #6762, this issue is not OS specific.
2. I see two potential candidates for a "more relevant" default:
    * The parent folder of the project folder that was added most recently.
    * The parent folder of the project folder of the currently opened file.

The former "feels more correct" (opinion), the latter is more in line with the fix for #6762

data.title: [API inconsistency] decorate marker with type=line with multiple classes throw exception
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode)?

* [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

### Description

Maybe this is duplicate of #4382

- decoration with `type: 'highlight'` accept space-separated-multiple-classes.
- decoration with `type: 'line'` NOT accept space-separated-multiple-classes.
- Issue happens both stable(v1.12) and beta(v1.1.3).

I want to use multiple class when decorate marker with `type: 'line'`.
This API inconsistency for `editor.decorateMarker()` is very confusing since I can use multiple classes for `type: 'highlight'` but not for `type: 'line'`.

### Steps to Reproduce

- Set following code in your `init.cson`
- When I decorate marker by `user:decorateCursorWord` command with `{type: 'highlight', class: 'class1 class2'}`, it add multiple classes.
- When I decorate marker by `user:decorateCursorLine` command with `{type: 'line', class: 'class1 class2'}`, it throw exception.
`Uncaught InvalidCharacterError: Failed to execute 'add' on 'DOMTokenList': The token provided ('class1 class2') contains HTML space characters, which are not valid in tokens.`

```coffeescript
decorateCursorWord = ->
  editor = atom.workspace.getActiveTextEditor()
  range = editor.getLastCursor().getCurrentWordBufferRange()
  marker = editor.markBufferRange(range)
  decorationOptions = {type: 'highlight', class: 'class1 class2'}
  decoration = editor.decorateMarker(marker, decorationOptions)
  # Accept multiple class, and can use both class in css to modify appearance.
  console.log decoration.getProperties() # >> Object {type: "line", class: "class1 class2"}


decorateCursorLine = ->
  editor = atom.workspace.getActiveTextEditor()
  range = editor.getLastCursor().getCurrentLineBufferRange()
  marker = editor.markBufferRange(range)
  decorationOptions = {type: 'line', class: 'class1 class2'}
  decoration = editor.decorateMarker(marker, decorationOptions)
  # Seem to decoration accept multiple classes, but throw error
  console.log decoration.getProperties() # >> Object {type: "line", class: "class1 class2"}

atom.commands.add 'atom-workspace',
  'user:decorateCursorWord': -> decorateCursorWord()
  'user:decorateCursorLine': -> decorateCursorLine()
```

### Versions

```
Atom    : 1.12.2
Electron: 1.3.6
Chrome  : 52.0.2743.82
Node    : 6.3.0
```
